entry.title: Freedom Is Up to You
entry.content:
When I am asked when we shall have a free market, my answer is, "It's up to you" :)

Lovers of freedom need to have these difficult conversations with their friends and family.  This can be a frightening prospect -- horrifying even.

Because deep inside we lovers of freedom know that these conversations will irrevocably alter our relationships.  We know this, and we are afraid of the consequences.  We are afraid of losing "friends", customers, career opportunities, comfortable relationships with relatives.  And yes, this is indeed a terrifying prospect.

The only thing more frightening than having these conversations is dying a coward:

To lie on your death bed and realise you let the chance to change the world for the better slip through your fingers.

Shabbat shalom to all the lovers of freedom.

entry.title: A Perspective on Moral Values -- Past, Present, Future
entry.content:
Moral values are objective.

I have proved this dozens if not hundreds of times in essays and discussions.
In short, this truth springs from the fact that Man is the owner of his own person, and this ownership is axiomatic.  The very attempt to argue with this axiom evidences its veracity.

So a perspective on moral values is not an overview of values that change over time, but rather the advancement towards and regression from this universal, timeless fact.  (Speaking mainly of people in the West)

In the past, the average citizen was not shocked by the sight of slavery in his midst, for he was born into a reality wherein slavery was a (seemingly) indispensable component of the human condition.

Today we look back at those who enslaved their fellow man, and we (at least most of us) see this phenomenon as monstrous.

Today, we see politicians who support robbing at the point of a gun, and Keynesians who support the existence of central banks and fiat currency, and today's average citizen is no more shocked by this than his predecessor was by slavery.

A day will come when people look back at us and say that the social-democrats and central bankers were monstrous, despicable fascists.

ערכי מוסר הם אובייקטיביים.

בקצרה, זה נובע מזה שאדם הוא הבעלים של עצמו, והבעלות הזאת היא אקסיומטית. עצם הניסיון להתווכח עם האקסיומה מהווה המחשה שהיא נכונה.
